title: UI master's student killed in accidental shooting
content:
SAC COUNTY, Iowa (KCRG-TV9) -- A University of Iowa master's student has died in an accidental shooting in western Iowa.
Friends say 24-year-old Megan Sloss was shot inside a car in Sac County on Sunday. The shooting happened when a passenger was handling a handgun that accidentally fired.
Sloss went to the hospital, where she later died.
According to her obituary, she was studying social services at the University of Iowa. She was also working at Iowa KidSight and the University of Iowa Hospitals and Clinics.
